result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Ryan Allen Kohl was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. 

Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  Defendant has the right to request expungement of DNA analysis in writing through the Department of Justice.

Bond shall be applied towards the financial obligations.  Remaining financial obligations shall be paid at the rate of $400 per month commencing November 1, 2022 or judgment shall enter for nonpayment. There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

Defendant Ryan Allen Kohl in court.  Attorney Eric Paul Pitsch in court for Ryan Allen Kohl.  Attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews the amended criminal complaint with defendant and finds probable cause.  On a plea to Ct 1, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct 2 and 22TR1285; Colloquy between Court and defendant regarding entry of no contest plea and defendant requests to amend the plea questionnaire, Court reviews plea questionnaire w/ defendant;  Free to argue sentencing; Guilty plea entered on Ct 1; Defendant admits to two prior OWI convictions; Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1, on motion of the State Ct 2 and 22TR1285 are dismissed and read in; Argument on sentencing from State, Defense; Statements from defendant; Defendant is convicted and sentenced.
